name: fortinet-fortisiem_dev
label: Fortinet FortiSIEM
description: FortiSIEM provides integrations that allow you to query and make changes to the CMDB, query events, and send incident notifications. Provide actions like get incidents, comment incident, cleared incident, get device details, get monitored organizations, report related actions and get all associated events for an incident from FortiSIEM.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: Specify the URL of the Fortinet FortiSIEM server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: server

fields.title: Username
fields.description: Specify the username used to access the Fortinet FortiSIEM server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: username

fields.title: Password
fields.description: Specify the password used to access the Fortinet FortiSIEM server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: password

fields.title: Organization
fields.description: Specify the name of the organization that you will access on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server to perform the automated operations.
fields.name: organization

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: List Incidents
operations.description: Retrieves a list and details of incidents from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the time range, and other filter criteria you have specified. NOTE: The FortiSIEM API does not support filtering incidents in the "List Incident" action based on sub-categories.

parameters.title: From
parameters.name: timeFrom
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start DateTime to retrieve incidents from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the start DateTime to retrieve incidents from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: To
parameters.name: timeTo
parameters.tooltip: Specify the end DateTime to retrieve the incidents from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the end DateTime to retrieve the incidents from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Incident Status
parameters.name: incidentStatus
parameters.description: (Optional) Select one or more incident statuses from the following options to filter incidents: Active Auto Cleared, Manually Cleared System Cleared
parameters.tooltip: Select one or more incident statuses from the following options to filter incidents: Active Auto Cleared, Manually Cleared System Cleared

parameters.title: Incident Category
parameters.name: incidentCategory
parameters.tooltip: Select one or more incident categories from the following options to filter incidents: Availability Performance, Changed Security Other
parameters.description: (Optional) Select one or more incident categories from the following options to filter incidents: Availability Performance, Changed Security Other

parameters.title: Incident Sub Category
parameters.name: incidentSubCategory
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sub-category of the incident based on which you want to retrieve incidents from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the sub-category of the incident based on which you want to retrieve incidents from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Incident Severity
parameters.tooltip: Select one or more incident severities from the following options to filter incidents: High Medium Low
parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: (Optional) Select one or more incident severities from the following options to filter incidents: High Medium Low

parameters.title: Event Type
parameters.name: eventType
parameters.tooltip: Specify the event type of the incident based on which you want to retrieve incidents from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the event type of the incident based on which you want to retrieve incidents from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Other Filters
parameters.tooltip: Specify the parameters in the JSON format using which you want to filter the incidents retrieved from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. For example, { "status": [ 0 ], "eventType": [ "PH_RULE_SERVER_CPU_WARN" ], "incidentRptIp": [ "10.7.12.156" ] }
parameters.name: search
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the parameters in the JSON format using which you want to filter the incidents retrieved from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. For example, { "status": [ 0 ], "eventType": [ "PH_RULE_SERVER_CPU_WARN" ], "incidentRptIp": [ "10.7.12.156" ] }

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return In Response or Size Per Page
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: For FortiSIEM 6.7.6: This parameter defines the maximum number of items that this operation will return, per page, in the response. For versions other than FortiSIEM 6.7.6: This parameter defines the maximum number of items that this operation will return in the response. By default, this parameter is set to 500 items.
parameters.description: (Optional) For FortiSIEM 6.7.6: This parameter defines the maximum number of items that this operation will return, per page, in the response. For versions other than FortiSIEM 6.7.6: This parameter defines the maximum number of items that this operation will return in the response. By default, this parameter is set to 500 items.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say incidents starting from the 10th incident. By default, this is set as 0.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say incidents starting from the 10th incident. By default, this is set as 0.

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.tooltip: Specify the field using which to sort the incidents retrieved from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can also specify the sort direction of the specified field. For example, incidentLastSeen DESC
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the field using which to sort the incidents retrieved from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can also specify the sort direction of the specified field. For example, incidentLastSeen DESC
parameters.name: orderBy

parameters.title: Event Fields To Show In Response
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated list of event fields that you want to include in the list of incidents that you want to retrieve from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.placeholder: e.g. eventSeverityCat, incidentLastSeen, incidentFirstSeen, incidentSrc, incidentTarget, incidentRptDevName
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the comma-separated list of event fields that you want to include in the list of incidents that you want to retrieve from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: fields

operations.title: Get Incident Details
operations.description: Retrieves details of an incident from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the incident IDs you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident IDs
parameters.tooltip: Specify the IDs of incidents, in the CSV or list format, whose details you want to retrieve from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Specify the IDs of incidents, in the CSV or list format, whose details you want to retrieve from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Update Incident
operations.description: Updates the attributes of a specific incident on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the incident ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Comment Text
parameters.tooltip: Specify the text of the comment that you want to add to the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: comments
parameters.description: Specify the text of the comment that you want to add to the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Incident Status
parameters.name: incidentStatus
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the incident status that you want to assign to the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can select one of the following options: Active Auto Cleared, Manually Cleared System Cleared
parameters.tooltip: Select the incident status that you want to assign to the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can select one of the following options: Active Auto Cleared, Manually Cleared System Cleared

parameters.title: Incident Severity
parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the incident severity that you want to assign to the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can select one of the following options: HIGH MEDIUM LOW
parameters.tooltip: Select the incident severity that you want to assign to the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can select one of the following options: HIGH MEDIUM LOW

parameters.title: Incident Resolution
parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the resolution that you want to assign to the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can choose between True Positive or False Positive.
parameters.tooltip: Select the resolution that you want to assign to the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can choose between True Positive or False Positive.

parameters.title: External Ticket Type
parameters.name: externalTicketType
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the external ticket type of the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can select one of the following options: High Medium Low
parameters.tooltip: Select the external ticket type of the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can select one of the following options: High Medium Low

parameters.title: External Ticket ID
parameters.name: externalTicketId
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the ID of the external ticket ID to update in the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the external ticket ID to update in the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: External Ticket State
parameters.name: externalTicketState
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the external ticket state of the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can select one of the following options: New Assigned In Progress Closed
parameters.tooltip: Select the external ticket state of the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can select one of the following options: New Assigned In Progress Closed

parameters.title: External Assigned User
parameters.name: externalAssignedUser
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the assigned user of the external ticket to update in the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the assigned user of the external ticket to update in the specified incident you want to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Comment Incident
operations.description: Adds a comment to a specific incident on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the incident ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident in which you want to add the comment on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the incident in which you want to add the comment on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Comment Text
parameters.name: comment_text
parameters.description: Specify the text of the comment that you want to add to the specified incident on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the text of the comment that you want to add to the specified incident on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Clear Incident With Reason
operations.description: Clears an incident with the reason you have specified on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the incident ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the incident that you want to clear from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident that you want to clear from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Reason
parameters.name: comment_text
parameters.description: Specify the text of the reason that you want to specify while clearing the specified incident from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the text of the reason that you want to specify while clearing the specified incident from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Get Events For Incident
operations.description: Retrieves all associated events for a specified incident from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server, based on the incident ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident for which you want to retrieve all associated events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the incident for which you want to retrieve all associated events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Time From
parameters.name: timeFrom
parameters.tooltip: Select the start time range from when you want to search raw events for the given incident ID. NOTE: This parameter is supported only in the FortiSIEM 6.7.6 version. Also, note that the max interval between the Time To and Time From cannot exceed 24 hours.
parameters.description: Select the start time range from when you want to search raw events for the given incident ID. NOTE: This parameter is supported only in the FortiSIEM 6.7.6 version. Also, note that the max interval between the Time To and Time From cannot exceed 24 hours.

parameters.title: Time To
parameters.name: timeTo
parameters.tooltip: Select the end time range till when you want to search raw events for the given incident ID. NOTE: This parameter is supported only in the FortiSIEM 6.7.6 version. Also, note that the max interval between the Time To and Time From cannot exceed 24 hours.
parameters.description: Select the end time range till when you want to search raw events for the given incident ID. NOTE: This parameter is supported only in the FortiSIEM 6.7.6 version. Also, note that the max interval between the Time To and Time From cannot exceed 24 hours.

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return In Response
parameters.name: perPage
parameters.tooltip: The maximum number of events that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, this parameter is set to 10 items.
parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of events that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, this parameter is set to 10 items.

operations.title: Search Events
operations.description: Searches for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on search attributes and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Search Attributes
parameters.tooltip: Select one or multiple search attributes to prepare your search query
parameters.description:
Select attribute types using which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can choose one or more search attributes from the following options: Destination Port, Destination IP, Event ID, Event Action, Incident ID, File Name, Host Name, Organization Name, Process Name, Post-NAT Source IP, Raw Event Log, Relay IP, Reporting Ip, Source IP, Source Port, Source MAC, or User  

If you choose 'Destination Port', then in the Destination Port IN field, enter the value of the destination port for which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Destination IP', then in the Destination IP IN field, enter a comma-separated list of destination IPs based on which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Event ID', then in the Event ID IN field, enter the value of the event ID for which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Event Action', then from the Event Action IN drop-down list, choose the event action for which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can choose 1-Deny or 0-Permit. 

If you choose 'Incident ID', then in the Incident ID IN field, enter the value of the Incident ID for which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'File Name', then in the File Name CONTAINS field, enter the name of the file based on which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Host Name', then in the Host Name CONTAINS field, enter the name of the host using which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Organization Name', then in the Organization Name CONTAINS field, enter the name of the organization based on which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Process Name', then in the Process Name CONTAINS field, enter the name of the process based on which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Post-NAT Source IP', then in the Post-NAT Source IP IN field, enter the Post-NAT source IP based on which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Raw Event Log', then in the Raw Event Log CONTAINS field, enter the search attribute for the raw event based on which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Relay IP', then in the Relay IP IN field, enter the relay IP based on which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Reporting IP', then in the Reporting IP IN field, enter the reporting IP based on which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Source IP', then in the Source IP IN field, enter the source IP based on which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Source Port', then in the Source Port IN field, enter the source port based on which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'Source MAC', then in the Source MAC CONTAINS field, enter the search attribute for the source MAC using which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. 

If you choose 'User', then in the User CONTAINS field, enter the search attribute for the user based on which you want to search for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: attribute

Destination Port.title: Destination Port IN
Destination Port.tooltip: Comma separated port numbers to search
Destination Port.name: destination_port_value
Destination Port.description: Enter value for attribute Destination Port

Destination IP.title: Destination IP IN
Destination IP.tooltip: Comma separated IP addresses to search
Destination IP.name: destination_ip_value
Destination IP.description: Enter value for attribute Destination IP

Event ID.title: Event ID IN
Event ID.name: event_id_value
Event ID.tooltip: Comma separated event IDs to search
Event ID.description: Enter value for attribute Event ID

Event Action.title: Event Action =
Event Action.name: event_action_value
Event Action.description: Enter value for attribute Event Action

Incident ID.title: Incident ID IN
Incident ID.tooltip: Comma separated incident ID values to search events
Incident ID.name: incident_id_value
Incident ID.description: Enter value for attribute Incident ID

File Name.title: File Name CONTAINS
File Name.tooltip: File name or part of file name to filter events
File Name.name: file_name_value
File Name.description: Enter value for attribute File Name

Host Name.title: Host Name CONTAINS
Host Name.tooltip: Host name or part of host name to filter events
Host Name.name: host_name_value
Host Name.description: Enter value for attribute Host Name

Organization Name.title: Organization Name CONTAINS
Organization Name.tooltip: Organization name or part of Organization name to filter events
Organization Name.name: organization_name_value
Organization Name.description: Enter value for attribute Organization Name

Process Name.title: Process Name CONTAINS
Process Name.tooltip: Process name or part of Process name to filter events
Process Name.name: process_name_value
Process Name.description: Enter value for attribute Process Name

Post-NAT Source IP.title: Post-NAT Source IP IN
Post-NAT Source IP.tooltip: comma separated values of Post-NAT Source IP to filter events
Post-NAT Source IP.name: post_nat_source_ip_value
Post-NAT Source IP.description: Enter value for attribute Post-NAT Source IP

Raw Event Log.title: Raw Event Log CONTAINS
Raw Event Log.tooltip: Enter text to search into raw event logs
Raw Event Log.name: raw_event_log_value
Raw Event Log.description: Enter value for attribute Raw Event Log

Relay IP.title: Relay IP IN
Relay IP.tooltip: comma separated values of Relay IP to filter events
Relay IP.name: relay_ip_value
Relay IP.description: Enter value for attribute Relay IP

Reporting IP.title: Reporting IP IN
Reporting IP.tooltip: comma separated values of Reporting IP to filter events
Reporting IP.name: reporting_ip_value
Reporting IP.description: Enter value for attribute Reporting IP

Source IP.title: Source IP IN
Source IP.tooltip: comma separated values of Source IP to filter events
Source IP.name: source_ip_value
Source IP.description: Enter value for attribute Source IP

Source Port.title: Source Port IN
Source Port.tooltip: comma separated values of Source Port to filter events
Source Port.name: source_port_value
Source Port.description: Enter value for attribute Source Port

Source MAC.title: Source MAC CONTAINS
Source MAC.tooltip: Enter source mac value or part of source mac value to filter events
Source MAC.name: source_mac_value
Source MAC.description: Enter value for attribute Source MAC

User.title: User CONTAINS
User.tooltip: Enter user name or part of user name to filter events
User.name: user_value

parameters.title: Event Fields To Show In Response
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated list of event fields that you want to include in the response retrieved from the FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the comma-separated list of event fields that you want to include in the response retrieved from the FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: select_clause

parameters.title: Time Range
parameters.name: time_selection
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the time duration to search for reports to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. By default, this is set as Relative Time. You can select from the following options: Relative Time: Specify values in the following fields: Relative Time: Select the unit of the duration from the following options: Minutes Hours Days Last: Select the quantity of the units for the duration selected. For example, if the unit selected was hours, select 2 to set the relative time duration as 2 hours. Absolute Time: Specify values in the following fields: From: (Optional) Specify the start DateTime for which to get events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. To: (Optional) Specify the end DateTime for which to get events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

Relative Time.title: Relative Time
Relative Time.tooltip: For example, if you choose Hours and provide the value 2, then this operation run report for last 2 hours, and return the response against the report from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
Relative Time.name: rel_time
Relative Time.description: (Optional) Specify the time range for which you want to run report for the specified time span. For example, if you choose Hours and provide 2 in the value, then this operation run report for last 2 hours, and return the response against the report from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

Absolute Time.title: From
Absolute Time.name: from
Absolute Time.tooltip: Provide the start datetime to get events
Absolute Time.description: (Optional) Specify the start datetime for which you want to get events on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

Absolute Time.title: To
Absolute Time.name: to
Absolute Time.tooltip: Provide the end datetime to run report
Absolute Time.description: (Optional) Specify the end datetime for which you want to get events on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.tooltip: Specify the time duration to search for reports to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. By default, this is set as Relative Time. You can select from the following options: Relative Time: Specify values in the following fields: Relative Time: Select the unit of the duration from the following options: Minutes Hours Days Last: Select the quantity of the units for the duration selected. For example, if the unit selected was hours, select 2 to set the relative time duration as 2 hours. Absolute Time: Specify values in the following fields: From: Specify the start DateTime for which to get events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. To: Specify the end DateTime for which to get events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return In Response
parameters.name: perPage
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of events that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, this parameter is set to 50 items.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of events that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, this parameter is set to 50 items.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of events, say events starting from the 10th event. By default, this is set as 0.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of events, say events starting from the 10th event. By default, this is set as 0.

operations.title: Get Event Details
operations.description: Retrieves details of a specific event from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the event ID you have specified and optionally the date range you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the event whose details you want to retrieve from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.tooltip: The ID of the event whose details you want to retrieve from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Event Fields To Show In Response
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated list of event fields that you want to include in the response retrieved from the FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the comma-separated list of event fields that you want to include in the response retrieved from the FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: select_clause

parameters.title: From
parameters.name: from
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start DateTime from when you want to retrieve event details from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the start DateTime from when you want to retrieve event details from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: To
parameters.name: to
parameters.tooltip: Specify the end DateTime till when you want to retrieve event details from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. Important: If you do not specify the From and To parameters for this operation, then by default events for the last 2 weeks will be retrieved from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the end DateTime till when you want to retrieve event details from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. Important: If you do not specify the From and To parameters for this operation, then by default events for the last 2 weeks will be retrieved from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Get All Devices
operations.description: Retrieves a short description for all devices that are configured on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization using which you want to filter the devices retrieved from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the name of the organization using which you want to filter the devices retrieved from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: org

operations.title: Get All Devices For Specified IP Address Range
operations.description: Retrieves a short description for devices that are configured on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server, based on the IP address range that you have specified.

parameters.title: Include IP SET
parameters.tooltip: Specify the value of IP addresses based on which you want to retrieve device information from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You must provide the value of this field as a range or in the .csv format. For example, enter, 192.168.20.1-192.168.20.100
parameters.description: Specify the value of IP addresses based on which you want to retrieve device information from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You must provide the value of this field as a range or in the .csv format. For example, enter, 192.168.20.1-192.168.20.100
parameters.name: includeIps

parameters.title: Exclude IP SET
parameters.tooltip: Specify the value of the range of IP addresses that you want to exclude from this search operation. You must provide the value of this field as a range or in the .csv format.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the value of the range of IP addresses that you want to exclude from this search operation. You must provide the value of this field as a range or in the .csv format.
parameters.name: excludeIps

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization using which you want to filter the devices retrieved from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the name of the organization using which you want to filter the devices retrieved from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: org

operations.title: Get Device Information
operations.description: Retrieves details of a specific device that is configured on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server, based on the Device IP that you have specified.

parameters.title: Device IP
parameters.description: Specify the IP address of the device for which you want to retrieve details from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: ip
parameters.tooltip: Specify the IP address of the device for which you want to retrieve details from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization for which you want to retrieve details of the device from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the name of the organization for which you want to retrieve details of the device from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: org

operations.title: List Monitored Devices and Attributes
operations.description: Retrieves a list and attributes of all monitored devices that are configured on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: List Monitored Organizations
operations.description: Retrieves a list and details of all monitored organizations that are configured on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Get Organization Details
operations.description: Retrieves the details of a specific organization from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the organization ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Organization ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the organization whose details you want to retrieve from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: domain_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the organization whose details you want to retrieve from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Run Advanced Search Query
operations.description: Runs an advanced search query on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server, based on the search conditions and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Advanced Search Query
parameters.tooltip: Specify the conditions using which you want to process the search results for the report that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. For example, (incidentDetail CONTAIN "jobName" AND phEventCategory = 1) AND (phCustId IN (1)).
parameters.description: Specify the conditions using which you want to process the search results for the report that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. For example, (incidentDetail CONTAIN "jobName" AND phEventCategory = 1) AND (phCustId IN (1)).
parameters.name: cond

parameters.title: Event Fields To Show In Response
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated list of event fields that you want to include in the response retrieved from the FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the comma-separated list of event fields that you want to include in the response retrieved from the FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: AttrList

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.tooltip: Specify the field using which you want to sort the search results for the report that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can also specify the sort direction of the specified field. For example, phRecvTime DESC
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the field using which you want to sort the search results for the report that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can also specify the sort direction of the specified field. For example, phRecvTime DESC
parameters.name: orderby

parameters.title: Time Range
parameters.name: time_selection
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the time duration to search for reports to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. By default, this is set as Relative Time. You can select from the following options: Relative Time: Specify values in the following fields: Relative Time: Select the unit of the duration from the following options: Minutes Hours Days Last: Select the quantity of the units for the duration selected. For example, if the unit selected was hours, select 2 to set the relative time duration as 2 hours. Absolute Time: Specify values in the following fields: From: (Optional) Specify the start DateTime for which to get events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. To: (Optional) Specify the end DateTime for which to get events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

Relative Time.title: Relative Time
Relative Time.tooltip: For example, if you choose Hours and provide the value 2, then this operation run report for last 2 hours, and return the response against the report from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
Relative Time.name: rel_time
Relative Time.description: (Optional) Specify the time range for which you want to run report for the specified time span. For example, if you choose Hours and provide 2 in the value, then this operation run report for last 2 hours, and return the response against the report from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

Absolute Time.title: From
Absolute Time.name: from
Absolute Time.tooltip: Provide the start datetime to run report
Absolute Time.description: (Optional) Specify the start datetime for which you want to run report in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

Absolute Time.title: To
Absolute Time.name: to
Absolute Time.tooltip: Provide the end datetime to run report
Absolute Time.description: (Optional) Specify the end datetime for which you want to run report in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.tooltip: Specify the time duration to search for reports to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. By default, this is set as Relative Time. You can select from the following options: Relative Time: Specify values in the following fields: Relative Time: Select the unit of the duration from the following options: Minutes Hours Days Last: Select the quantity of the units for the duration selected. For example, if the unit selected was hours, select 2 to set the relative time duration as 2 hours. Absolute Time: Specify values in the following fields: From: Specify the start DateTime for which to get events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. To: Specify the end DateTime for which to get events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return In Response
parameters.name: perPage
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of events that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, this parameter is set to 50 items.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of events that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, this parameter is set to 50 items.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of events, say events starting from the 10th event. By default, this is set as 0.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of events, say events starting from the 10th event. By default, this is set as 0.

operations.title: Get Event Attributes
operations.description: Retrieves all event attributes from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Get Events Data By Query ID
operations.description: Retrieves data for events or incidents from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the executed query ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Query ID
parameters.name: query_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the executed query based on which you want to retrieve data of events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can retrieve the Query ID from the output of actions such as List Incidents, Search Query, etc.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the executed query based on which you want to retrieve data of events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can retrieve the Query ID from the output of actions such as List Incidents, Search Query, etc.

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return In Response
parameters.name: perPage
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of items that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 50 items.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of items that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 50 items.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say incidents starting from the 10th incident. By default, this is set as 0.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say incidents starting from the 10th incident. By default, this is set as 0.

operations.title: Create Watch List
operations.description: Creates a watch list in the FortiSIEM database. A watch list can contain one or more watch list entries.

parameters.title: Watch List JSON Object
parameters.name: json_object
parameters.tooltip: Specify the JSON Object of a watch list with a watch list entry to create in the FortiSIEM database. For example: { "description":"Servers,networkorstoragedevices", "displayName":"ResourceIssuesTest4", "type":"DyWatchList", "isCaseSensitive":false, "dataCreationType":"USER", "topGroup":false, "valuePattern":null, "valueType":"STRING", "ageOut":"1d", "custId":1, "entries":[ { "inclusive":true, "entryValue":"PVVol_A001_A000356_5new", "ageOut":"1d", "count":1, "custId":1, "firstSeen":1612901760000, "lastSeen":1612901760000, "triggeringRules":"DatastoreSpaceWarning", "dataCreationType":"USER" } ] } NOTE: displayName and type are required fields.
parameters.description: Specify the JSON Object of a watch list with a watch list entry to create in the FortiSIEM database. For example: { "description":"Servers,networkorstoragedevices", "displayName":"ResourceIssuesTest4", "type":"DyWatchList", "isCaseSensitive":false, "dataCreationType":"USER", "topGroup":false, "valuePattern":null, "valueType":"STRING", "ageOut":"1d", "custId":1, "entries":[ { "inclusive":true, "entryValue":"PVVol_A001_A000356_5new", "ageOut":"1d", "count":1, "custId":1, "firstSeen":1612901760000, "lastSeen":1612901760000, "triggeringRules":"DatastoreSpaceWarning", "dataCreationType":"USER" } ] } NOTE: displayName and type are required fields.

operations.title: Get Watch Lists
operations.description: Retrieves details for all watch lists or for specific watch lists based on input parameters you have specified.

conditional_output_schema.condition: {{(get_watch_list_by === 'Get All Watch Lists' || get_watch_list_by === 'By Watch List ID' || get_watch_list_by === 'By Watch List Entry Value')}}

parameters.title: Get Watch List Data By
parameters.name: get_watch_list_by

By Watch List ID.title: Watch List ID
By Watch List ID.name: watch_list_id
By Watch List ID.tooltip: Watch list id of a specific watch list.
By Watch List ID.description: Watch list id of a specific watch list.

By Watch List Entry Value.title: Entry Value
By Watch List Entry Value.name: entryValue
By Watch List Entry Value.tooltip: Entry value of watch list entry.
By Watch List Entry Value.description: Entry value of watch list entry.

By Watch List Entry ID.title: Watch List Entry ID
By Watch List Entry ID.name: watch_list_entry_id
By Watch List Entry ID.tooltip: Watch list entry id to get watch list data
By Watch List Entry ID.description: Retrieves a specific watch list which contains a watch list entry with given entry ID

parameters.description: Select the parameters using which you want to retrieve watch list data from Fortinet FortiSIEM. If you choose Get All Watch Lists, then data for all watch lists are retrieved from Fortinet FortiSIEM. If you choose By Watch List ID, then in the Watch List IDfield you must specify the ID of the watch list whose details you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiSIEM. If you choose By Watch List Entry Value, then in the Entry Valuefield you must specify the value of the watch list entry whose watch list details you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiSIEM. If you choose By Watch List Entry ID, then in the Watch List Entry IDfield you must specify the ID of the watch list entry whose watch list details you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiSIEM.
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameters using which you want to retrieve watch list data from Fortinet FortiSIEM. If you choose Get All Watch Lists, then data for all watch lists are retrieved from Fortinet FortiSIEM. If you choose By Watch List ID, then in the Watch List IDfield you must specify the ID of the watch list whose details you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiSIEM. If you choose By Watch List Entry Value, then in the Entry Valuefield you must specify the value of the watch list entry whose watch list details you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiSIEM. If you choose By Watch List Entry ID, then in the Watch List Entry IDfield you must specify the ID of the watch list entry whose watch list details you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiSIEM.

operations.title: Get Watch List Entries Count
operations.description: Returns the count of all watch list entries from all watch lists in Fortinet FortiSIEM.

operations.title: Get Watch List Entry
operations.description: Retrieves the specific watch list entry from Fortinet FortiSIEM based on the watch list entry ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Watch List Entry ID
parameters.name: watch_list_entry_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the watch list entry that you want to retrieve from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the watch list entry that you want to retrieve from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Add Watch List Entries to Watch List
operations.description: Adds watch list entries to one or more watch lists based on watch list ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Watch List ID
parameters.name: watch_list_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the watch list to which you want to add watch list entries.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the watch list to which you want to add watch list entries.

parameters.title: Other parameters
parameters.name: other_params
parameters.tooltip: Specify a JSON Array of watch list entry objects that you want to add to specific watch lists. For example, { "inclusive": false, "count": 10, "custId": 1, "triggeringRules": "Datastore Space Warning", "entryValue": "PVVol_A001_A000356_POWER2", "ageOut": "1d", "lastSeen": 1613601369215, "firstSeen": 1613601369215, "disableAgeout": false, "dataCreationType": "USER" }
parameters.description: Specify a JSON Array of watch list entry objects that you want to add to specific watch lists. For example, { "inclusive": false, "count": 10, "custId": 1, "triggeringRules": "Datastore Space Warning", "entryValue": "PVVol_A001_A000356_POWER2", "ageOut": "1d", "lastSeen": 1613601369215, "firstSeen": 1613601369215, "disableAgeout": false, "dataCreationType": "USER" }

operations.title: Update Watch List Entry
operations.description: Updates a watch list entry in the FortiSIEM database based on the watch list entry ID and other input parameters you have provided.

parameters.title: Watch List Entry ID
parameters.name: watch_list_entry_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the watch list entry that you want to update in the FortiSIEM database.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the watch list entry that you want to update in the FortiSIEM database.

parameters.title: Count
parameters.name: count
parameters.tooltip: Specify the occurrence count of the watch list entry that you want to update in the FortiSIEM database.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the occurrence count of the watch list entry that you want to update in the FortiSIEM database.

parameters.title: Last Seen Time
parameters.name: lastSeenTime
parameters.tooltip: Specify the value of the last seen time, i.e., the Unix timestamp, of the specific watch list that you want to update in the FortiSIEM database.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the value of the last seen time, i.e., the Unix timestamp, of the specific watch list that you want to update in the FortiSIEM database.

parameters.title: State
parameters.name: state
parameters.tooltip: From the State drop-down list select Active to set the specific watch list to the Active state; select Inactive to set the specific watch list to the Inactive state.
parameters.description: From the State drop-down list select Active to set the specific watch list to the Active state; select Inactive to set the specific watch list to the Inactive state.

parameters.title: Other Parameters
parameters.name: other_params
parameters.tooltip: JSON Object of a watch list with a watch list entry that you want to update in the FortiSIEM database. For example { "lastSeen": 1612901760002, "dataCreationType": "USER", "firstSeen": 1612901760001, "count": 100, "custId": 1, "triggeringRules": "Datastore Space Warning", "description": "Testing again", "id": 889400, "inclusive": true, "entryValue": "PVVol_A001_A000356_POWER23", "expiredTime": 1612988160001, "ageOut": "2d" }
parameters.description: JSON Object of a watch list with a watch list entry that you want to update in the FortiSIEM database. For example { "lastSeen": 1612901760002, "dataCreationType": "USER", "firstSeen": 1612901760001, "count": 100, "custId": 1, "triggeringRules": "Datastore Space Warning", "description": "Testing again", "id": 889400, "inclusive": true, "entryValue": "PVVol_A001_A000356_POWER23", "expiredTime": 1612988160001, "ageOut": "2d" }

operations.title: Delete Watch List Entry
operations.description: Deletes watch list entries from the FortiSIEM database based on the ID of the watch list entries you have specified.

parameters.title: Watch List Entry IDs
parameters.name: watch_list_entry_ids
parameters.tooltip: Specify the IDs of the watch list entries, in the CSV or list format, that you want to delete from the FortiSIEM database. For example, [5.0.10, 5.0.11]
parameters.description: Specify the IDs of the watch list entries, in the CSV or list format, that you want to delete from the FortiSIEM database. For example, [5.0.10, 5.0.11]

operations.title: Delete Watch List
operations.description: Deletes watch lists from the FortiSIEM database based on the ID of the watch lists you have specified.

parameters.title: Watch List IDs
parameters.name: watch_list_ids
parameters.tooltip: IDs of the watch lists, in the CSV or list format, that you want to delete from the FortiSIEM database. For example, [5.0.10, 5.0.11]
parameters.description: IDs of the watch lists, in the CSV or list format, that you want to delete from the FortiSIEM database. For example, [5.0.10, 5.0.11]

operations.title: Create Lookup Table
operations.description: Creates the definition of a lookup table in the FortiSIEM server based on the name, column list, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the lookup table that you want to create in FortiSIEM. NOTE: The table name must contain only alphabets and numbers.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the lookup table that you want to create in FortiSIEM. NOTE: The table name must contain only alphabets and numbers.

parameters.title: Column List
parameters.name: columnList
parameters.tooltip: Specify the list of column definitions for the lookup table to create in FortiSIEM. For each column, you must specify the following three values: key: Specify a key indicating whether the column is a primary column name: Specify the name of the column type: Specify the type of the column, for example, STRING, LONG, or DOUBLE. For example, [ { "key": true, "name": "url", "type": "STRING" }, { "key": false, "name": "wfCategoryID", "type": "LONG" } ]
parameters.description: Specify the list of column definitions for the lookup table to create in FortiSIEM. For each column, you must specify the following three values: key: Specify a key indicating whether the column is a primary column name: Specify the name of the column type: Specify the type of the column, for example, STRING, LONG, or DOUBLE. For example, [ { "key": true, "name": "url", "type": "STRING" }, { "key": false, "name": "wfCategoryID", "type": "LONG" } ]

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.tooltip: Specify the description of the lookup table that you want to create in FortiSIEM.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the description of the lookup table that you want to create in FortiSIEM.

parameters.title: Organization Name
parameters.name: organizationName
parameters.tooltip: Specify the organization name to be assigned to the lookup table that you want to create in FortiSIEM. By default, this is set to the organization of the current user.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the organization name to be assigned to the lookup table that you want to create in FortiSIEM. By default, this is set to the organization of the current user.

operations.title: Get All Lookup Table
operations.description: Retrieves the list of all lookupTable definitions from the FortiSIEM server based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: stat
parameters.tooltip: Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say lookup table definitions starting from the 10th position. By default, this is set as 0.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say lookup table definitions starting from the 10th position. By default, this is set as 0.

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of items that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 25 items, and the maximum is set at 1000.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of items that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 25 items, and the maximum is set at 1000.

operations.title: Delete Lookup Table
operations.description: Deletes the lookupTable definition from the FortiSIEM server based on the lookup table ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Lookup Table ID
parameters.name: lookupTableId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup Table whose definitions you want to delete from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup Table whose definitions you want to delete from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Import Lookup Table Data
operations.description: Imports the data of a specific CSV file in FortiSOAR to a specific lookup table in FortiSIEM based on the File/Attachment IRI, lookup table ID, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.name: input
parameters.title: File IRI/Attachment ID
parameters.description: Select the method using which you want to import the CSV file present in FortiSOAR to the Fortinet FortiSIEM server lookup table. You can choose between Attachment ID and File IRI. If you choose Attachment ID, then in the Attachment ID field specify the Attachment ID of the CSV file that you want to import into the specified lookup table in FortiSIEM. If you choose File IRI, then in the File IRI field specify the CSV file that you want to import into the specified lookup table in FortiSIEM.

Attachment ID.name: file
Attachment ID.title: Attachment ID
Attachment ID.tooltip: Attachment ID of the csv file that you want to import into lookup table
Attachment ID.description: Specify the Attachment ID of the CSV file that you want to import into the specified lookup table in FortiSIEM

File IRI.name: file
File IRI.title: File IRI
File IRI.tooltip: File IRI of the csv file that you want to import into lookup table
File IRI.description: Specify the CSV file that you want to import into the specified lookup table in FortiSIEM

parameters.tooltip: Select the method using which you want to import the CSV file present in FortiSOAR to the Fortinet FortiSIEM server lookup table. You can choose between Attachment ID and File IRI. If you choose Attachment ID, then in the Attachment ID field specify the Attachment ID of the CSV file that you want to import into the specified lookup table in FortiSIEM. If you choose File IRI, then in the File IRI field specify the CSV file that you want to import into the specified lookup table in FortiSIEM.

parameters.title: Lookup Table ID
parameters.name: lookupTableId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table in FortiSIEM into which you want to import the CSV file in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table in FortiSIEM into which you want to import the CSV file in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Mapping
parameters.name: mapping
parameters.tooltip: Specify the configuration that matches the position of columns in the CSV file to columns in the specified lookup table. The format of the mapping is as follows: {"":,"":}. For example, { "url": 1, "wfCategoryID": 2 }
parameters.description: Specify the configuration that matches the position of columns in the CSV file to columns in the specified lookup table. The format of the mapping is as follows: {"":,"":}. For example, { "url": 1, "wfCategoryID": 2 }

parameters.title: File Separator
parameters.name: fileSeparator
parameters.tooltip: Specify the file separator for the specified CSV file. By default, this is set as the comma character(,)
parameters.description: Specify the file separator for the specified CSV file. By default, this is set as the comma character(,)

parameters.title: File Quote Char
parameters.name: fileQuoteChar
parameters.tooltip: Specify the file quote character for the specified CSV file. By default, this is set as the double quotation character(")
parameters.description: Specify the file quote character for the specified CSV file. By default, this is set as the double quotation character(")

parameters.title: Skip Header
parameters.name: skipHeader
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to ignore the header of the specified CSV file.
parameters.description: Select this option to ignore the header of the specified CSV file.

parameters.title: Update Type
parameters.name: updateType
parameters.tooltip: Select the method of updating the data in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can choose between Overwrite (default) or Append.
parameters.description: Select the method of updating the data in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can choose between Overwrite (default) or Append.

operations.title: Check Import Task Status
operations.description: Checks the status of the import lookup table data task in FortiSIEM based on the lookup table ID and task ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Lookup Table ID
parameters.name: lookupTableId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server for which you want to check the import task status.
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server for which you want to check the import task status.

parameters.title: Task ID
parameters.name: taskId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the task id of the importing data to the specified lookup table. You can retrieve the task ID from the response of the "Import Lookup Table Data" action.
parameters.description: Specify the task id of the importing data to the specified lookup table. You can retrieve the task ID from the response of the "Import Lookup Table Data" action.

operations.title: Get Lookup Table Data
operations.description: Retrieves items of the specified lookup table from FortiSIEM based on the lookup table ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Lookup Table ID
parameters.name: lookupTableId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table for which you want to retrieve items from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table for which you want to retrieve items from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Start
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say lookup table items starting from the 10th position. By default, this is set as 0.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say lookup table items starting from the 10th position. By default, this is set as 0.

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of items that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 25 items, and the maximum is set at 1000.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of items that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 25 items, and the maximum is set at 1000.

parameters.title: Search Text
parameters.name: searchText
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Search text using which you want to filter items of the specified lookup table in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Search text using which you want to filter items of the specified lookup table in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.tooltip: Specify the lookup table columns using which you want to sort the search results retrieved from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can also specify the sort direction of the specified lookup table columns, i.e., descending (DESC) or ascending (ASC).
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the lookup table columns using which you want to sort the search results retrieved from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can also specify the sort direction of the specified lookup table columns, i.e., descending (DESC) or ascending (ASC).

operations.title: Update Lookup Table Data
operations.description: Updates items of a specified lookup table based on the lookup table ID, key, column data, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Lookup Table ID
parameters.name: lookupTableId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table whose items you want to update in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table whose items you want to update in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Key
parameters.name: key
parameters.tooltip: Specify the primary key of the item column and its value that you want to update in the specified lookup table. The format is <keyColumn_1>:<value> For example, key={"url":"http://example.com"}
parameters.description: Specify the primary key of the item column and its value that you want to update in the specified lookup table. The format is <keyColumn_1>:<value> For example, key={"url":"http://example.com"}

parameters.title: Column Data
parameters.name: columnData
parameters.tooltip: Specify the dictionary of column values to update in the specified lookup table. For example, { "url": "www.test.com", "wfCategoryID": 30, "score": 0.50119 }
parameters.description: Specify the dictionary of column values to update in the specified lookup table. For example, { "url": "www.test.com", "wfCategoryID": 30, "score": 0.50119 }

operations.title: Delete Lookup Table Data
operations.description: Delete items of the specified lookup table in FortiSIEM based on the lookup table ID and primary keys you have specified.

parameters.title: Lookup Table ID
parameters.name: lookupTableId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table whose items you want to delete from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table whose items you want to delete from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Primary Keys
parameters.name: keys_data
parameters.tooltip: Specify the list of primary keys of the item columns and their values that you want to delete from the specified lookup table. The format is: [ { "keyColumn_1": "value", "keyColumn_2": "value" } ]
parameters.description: Specify the list of primary keys of the item columns and their values that you want to delete from the specified lookup table. The format is: [ { "keyColumn_1": "value", "keyColumn_2": "value" } ]

operations.title: Get IP Context
operations.description: Retrieves the contextual data of the specified IP such as hostname, device type, location, device properties and known device information.

parameters.title: IP Address
parameters.name: value
parameters.tooltip: Specify the IP address for which to retrieve context from FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the IP address for which to retrieve context from FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Get Host Context
operations.description: Retrieves the contextual data of the specified hostname such as device type, and domain lookup information if an FQDN is supplied.

parameters.title: Host Name
parameters.name: value
parameters.tooltip: Specify the host name for which to retrieve context from FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the host name for which to retrieve context from FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Get User Context
operations.description: Retrieves the contextual data of the specified user such as known groups, location data, and top event types associated with this user account.

parameters.title: User Name
parameters.name: value
parameters.tooltip: Specify the user name for which to retrieve context from FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: Specify the user name for which to retrieve context from FortiSIEM server.
